ugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.17.zip";s:6:"2.0.19";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.19.zip";s:5:"2.0.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.2.zip";s:5:"2.0.3";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.3.zip";s:5:"2.0.4";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.4.zip";s:5:"2.0.5";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.5.zip";s:5:"2.0.6";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.6.zip";s:5:"2.0.7";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.7.zip";s:5:"2.0.8";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.8.zip";s:5:"2.0.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.9.zip";s:5:"2.1.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.1.0.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:19:"http://podlove.org/";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545651";s:2:"2x";s:71:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1545651";s:3:"svg";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545651";}s:18:"author_block_count";i:0;s:19:"author_block_rating";i:60;s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";a:31:{s:4:"name";s:24:"Podlove Subscribe button";s:4:"slug";s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.3.7";s:6:"author";s:41:"<a href="https://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chemiker";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:18118;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2019-10-31 10:24pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-04-15";s:8:"homepage";s:62:"https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/podlove-subscribe-button/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2029:"<p>This plugin allows easy inclusion of the Podlove Subscribe Button. Put it in your sidebar with a simple widget or include the button in pages and/or posts with a simple shortcode.</p>
<h3>About the Podlove Subscribe Button</h3>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button allows for simple subscription of podcasts in anybody&#8217;s favorite podcast app right from the browser without having to deal with pesky feed URLs and go on a hunt for feed subscription dialogues.</p>
<p>The button knows how to activate the subscription functionality in all popular podcast apps supporting various operating systems including but not limited to iOS, Android, WindowsPhone, OSX, Windows and Linux.</p>
<p>The button is centrally hosted and gets permanently updated when new podcast apps emerge or when new features are added. Using the button ensures your podcast can easily be subscribed to and presents an ever more popular user interface that your audience gets more and more used to.</p>
<h3>About Podlove</h3>
<p>Podlove is an open source initiative to improve the overall podcasting infrastructure and to come up with simple but helpful standards and tools to make publishing and listening to podcast as easy as possible.</p>
<p>Podlove currently provides:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://publisher.podlove.org" rel="nofollow"><strong><em>Podlove Podcast Publisher</em></strong></a> &#8211; a powerful plugin for WordPress for podcasters to publish metadata-rich podcasts</li>
<li><strong><em>Podlove Web Player</em></strong> &#8211; a podcast-optimized HTML5 web player with chapter support</li>
<li><a href="https://subscribe-button.podlove.org" rel="nofollow"><strong><em>Podlove Subscribe Button</em></strong></a> &#8211; a centrally hosted universal podcast subscribe button for the web</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podlove Project: https://podlove.org/</li>
<li>Podlove Community: https://community.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Documentation: https://docs.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Donate: https://podlove.org/donations/</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:4139:"<h3>Install the plugin</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
<h3>Configure buttons</h3>
<ol>
<li>Navigate to <code>Settings &gt; Podlove Subscribe Button</code></li>
<li>Fill out all fields, save and grab the shortcode</li>
<li>Add the button to your blog using the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button id="{{yourButtonID}}"]</code> with your button ID, or use the provided Podlove Subscribe Button Widget</li>
</ol>
<h3>Display the Subscribe Button in your Sidebar using a Widget</h3>
<p>Go to <code>Appearance -&gt; Widgets</code> and drag the &#8220;Podlove Subscribe Button&#8221; widget to your sidebar configuration. Select the pre-configured button from the list and determine which style you want. That&#8217;s it. The button should show up in your sidebar. Optionally add a title and description for your widget.</p>
<p>This is the easiest and recommended way of using this plugin especially if you ony want to display a button for a single podcast. For best visibility choose size &#8220;big&#8221; and format &#8220;cover&#8221; to make your Subscribe Button stand out and easily locatable.</p>
<h3>Include the Subscribe Button in WordPress pages using a Shortcode</h3>
<p>If you want to include a Podlove Subscribe Button in a WordPress page (or a post) just put the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button]</code> at the desired position in your text. Use the following shortcode parameters to configure it properly:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>button</code> &#8211; the ID of one of your preconfigured buttons</li>
<li><code>size</code> &#8211; one of &#8216;small&#8217;, &#8216;medium&#8217;, &#8216;big&#8217;</li>
<li><code>width</code> &#8211; specify desired button width in CSS compatibles values or &#8216;auto&#8217; automatic width depending on context.</li>
<li><code>color</code> &#8211; specify the color of the button in a CSS compatible format (keyword, rgb-hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla)</li>
<li><code>style</code> &#8211; default is filled, options are &#8216;outline&#8217; and &#8216;frameless&#8217;</li>
<li><code>format</code> &#8211; default is a rectangle, options are &#8216;square&#8217; and &#8216;cover&#8217; (<strong>Note</strong>: &#8216;cover&#8217; has a max size of 300px)</li>
<li><code>hide</code> &#8211; if set to <code>true</code> the button will not be shown (useful if you want to use your own element)</li>
<li><code>language</code> &#8211; specify the language the texts on the button and popup should be in (currently supports &#8216;de&#8217;, &#8216;en&#8217;, &#8216;eo&#8217;, &#8216;fi&#8217;, &#8216;fr&#8217;, &#8216;nl&#8217;, &#8216;zh&#8217; and &#8216;ja&#8217;)</li>
</ul>
<p>Note that if you do not provide one of the attributes the subscribe button will use the globally set default.</p>
<h3>Shortcode Examples</h3>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton1" size="big"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a large button with the podcast logo on top using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton1&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton2" size="medium" width="100pt" language="de"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small button with a width of 100pt using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton2&#8221; in german. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton3" size="big" width="auto" format="cover"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a big button with a the podcast cover and automatically adjusted using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton3&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton4" format="square" style="frameless"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small, frameless square button with using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton4&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1363:"
<h4>I&#8217;m running the Podlove Publisher. Do I need this plugin to display a Subscribe button?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and No. If you simply want to display a Subscribe Button for your Podcast you publish with the Podlove Publisher you do not need this plugin as the Publisher itself provides this functionality. If you want to display multiple Subscribe Buttons you can use the Subscribe Button plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where do I create those &#8220;Network-wide&#8221; Buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can find the Panel in the Networks Settings Section</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin actually contain the code for the button?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. This plugin just embeds the code that is needed to display the Podlove Subscribe Button. The button itself is served live from api.podlove.org</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I update the plugin to get support for more clients?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. As the Podlove Subscribe Button is hosted centrally, it gets updated regularly independent from this pugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>I am a podcast app developer and would like my app be listed in the button. What do I need to do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Consult the information provided on <a href="https://podlove.org/podlove-subscribe-button" rel="nofollow">the technical information page</a> at podlove.org on how the button works and what app developers need to support and do in order to get listed in the button.</p>
</p>

ton/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545649";}s:18:"author_block_count";i:0;s:19:"author_block_rating";i:100;s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:12:"antispam-bee";a:31:{s:4:"name";s:12:"Antispam Bee";s:4:"slug";s:12:"antispam-bee";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.9.1";s:6:"author";s:57:"<a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org">pluginkollektiv</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/pluginkollektiv";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.2.5";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:147;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:6;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:157;s:15:"support_threads";i:10;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:7;s:10:"downloaded";i:3057978;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-09-15 5:17pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-01-10";s:8:"homepage";s:43:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/antispam-bee/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2567:"<p>Say Goodbye to comment spam on your WordPress blog or website. <em>Antispam Bee</em> blocks spam comments and trackbacks effectively, without captchas and without sending personal information to third party services. It is free of charge, ad-free and 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<p><a href="http://coderisk.com/wp/plugin/antispam-bee/RIPS-J23dtT1_jC" rel="nofollow"></a></p>
<h3>Feature/Settings Overview</h3>
<ul>
<li>Trust approved commenters.</li>
<li>Trust commenters with a Gravatar.</li>
<li>Consider the comment time.</li>
<li>Allow comments only in a certain language.</li>
<li>Block or allow commenters from certain countries.</li>
<li>Treat BBCode as spam.</li>
<li>Validate the IP address of commenters.</li>
<li>Use regular expressions.</li>
<li>Search local spam database for commenters previously marked as spammers.</li>
<li>Notify admins by e-mail about incoming spam.</li>
<li>Delete existing spam after n days.</li>
<li>Limit approval to comments/pings (will delete other comment types).</li>
<li>Select spam indicators to send comments to deletion directly.</li>
<li>Optionally exclude trackbacks and pingbacks from spam detection.</li>
<li>Optionally spam-check comment forms on archive pages.</li>
<li>Display spam statistics on the dashboard, including daily updates of spam detection rate and a total of blocked spam comments.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Support</h3>
<ul>
<li>Community support via the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums on wordpress.org</a></li>
<li>Read <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki/en-Documentation" rel="nofollow">the documentation</a></li>
<li>We don’t handle support via e-mail, Twitter, GitHub issues etc.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<ul>
<li>Active development of this plugin is handled <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">on GitHub</a>.</li>
<li>Pull requests for documented bugs are highly appreciated.</li>
<li>If you think you’ve found a bug (e.g. you’re experiencing unexpected behavior), please post at the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums</a> first.</li>
<li>If you want to help us translate this plugin you can do so <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">on WordPress Translate</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<ul>
<li>Author: <a href="https://sergejmueller.github.io/" rel="nofollow">Sergej Müller</a></li>
<li>Maintainers: <a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org" rel="nofollow">pluginkollektiv</a></li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:554:"<ul>
<li>If you don’t know how to install a plugin for WordPress, <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Managing_Plugins#Installing_Plugins" rel="nofollow">here’s how</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Requirements</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.2.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress 3.8 or greater</li>
</ul>
<h3>Settings</h3>
<p>After you have activated <em>Antispam Bee</em> the plugin will block spam comments out of the box. However, you may want to visit <em>Settings → Antispam Bee</em> to configure your custom set of anti-spam options that works best for your site.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:2539:"
<h4>Does Antispam Bee work with Jetpack, Disqus Comments and other comment plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It is not compatible with Jetpack or Disqus Comments as those plugins load the comment form within an iframe. Thus Antispam Bee can not access the comment form directly.<br />
It also won’t work with any AJAX-powered comment forms.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee store any private user data, and is it compliant with GDPR?</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee is developed in Europe. You might have heard we can be a bit nitpicky over here when it comes to privacy. The plugin does not save private user data and is 100% compliant with GDPR.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will I have to edit any theme templates to get Antispam Bee to work?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, the plugin works as is. You may want to configure your favorite settings, though.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee work with shortened IPs?</h4>
<p>
<p>Generally yes. However, commissioning the Antispam Bee plugin for canceled or shortened IP addresses in comment metadata is not recommended. Because the name and the e-mail address of the comments are not unique, an IP address is the only reliable measure. The more complete the stored IP addresses, the more reliable the assignment or detection of spam.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I submit undetected spam?</h4>
<p>
<p>If the antispam plugin has passed some spam comments, these comments can be reported for analysis. A <a href="http://goo.gl/forms/ITzVHXkLVL" rel="nofollow">Google table</a> was created for this purpose.</p>
</p>
<h4>Antispam Bee with Varnish?</h4>
<p>
<p>If WordPress is operated with Apache + Varnish, the actual IP address of the visitors does not appear in WordPress. Accordingly the Antispam-Plugin lacks the base for the correct functionality. An adaptation in the Varnish configuration file /etc/varnish/default.vcl provides a remedy and forwards the original (not from Apache) IP address in the HTTP header X-Forwarded-For:</p>
<pre><code>`
</code></pre>
<p>if (req.restarts == 0) {<br />
    set req.http.X-Forwarded-For = client.ip;<br />
}<br />
    `</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there some paid services or limitations?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Antispam Bee is free forever, for both private and commercial projects. You can use it on as many sites as you want. There is no limitation to the number of sites you use the plugin on.</p>
<p>A complete documentation is available in the <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow">GitHub repository Wiki</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:6053:"<h3>2.9.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improved backend accessibility</li>
<li>Prefilled comment textareas do now work with the honeypot</li>
<li>AMP compatibility</li>
<li>Improved dashboard tooltips</li>
<li>Improvements for the language detection API</li>
<li>Scalable IP look up for local spam database</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Introduction of coding standards.</li>
<li>Switch to franc language detection API for the language check.</li>
<li>Do not longer overwrite the IP address WordPress saves with the comment by using <code>pre_comment_user_ip</code>.</li>
<li>Do not show &#8220;Trust commenters with a Gravatar&#8221; if the &#8220;Show Gravatar&#8221; option is not set.</li>
<li>Skip the checks, when I ping myself.</li>
<li>Fixes some wrong usages of the translation functions.</li>
<li>Use the regular expressions check also for trackbacks.</li>
<li>Add option to delete Antispam Bee related data when plugin gets deleted via the admin interface.</li>
<li>Save a hashed + salted IP for every comment</li>
<li>New check for incoming trackbacks.</li>
<li>Introduction of behat tests.</li>
<li>Updates the used JavaScript library for the statistics widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix in the &#8220;Comment form used outside of posts&#8221; option.</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.3 compatibility</li>
<li>Bugfix where a spam trackback produced a fatal error</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/8?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removed stopforumspam.com to avoid potential GDPR violation</li>
<li>Improves IP handling to comply with GDPR</li>
<li>Improves PHP7.2 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixes small bug on mobile views</li>
<li>Allow more than one language in language check</li>
<li>Minor interface improvements</li>
<li>Remove old russian and Dutch translation files</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/4?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixes an incompatibility with Chrome autofill</li>
<li>Fixes some incompatibilities with other plugins/themes where the comment field was left empty</li>
<li>Support for RTL</li>
<li>Solve some translation/language issues</li>
<li>A new filter to add languages to the language check</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/6?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Country check is back again (thanks to Sergej Müller for his amazing work and the service page)</li>
<li>Improved Honeypot</li>
<li>Language check through Google Translate API is back again (thanks to Simon Kraft of https://moenus.net/ for offering to cover the costs)</li>
<li>More default Regexes</li>
<li>Unit Test Framework</li>
<li>Accessibility and GUI improvements</li>
<li>An <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow">english documentation</a> is now available, too. Some corrections in the german documentation.</li>
<li>Some bugfixes &#8211; Among other things for WPML compatibility</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/3?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.9</h3>
<ul>
<li>Updates donation links throughout the plugin</li>
<li>Fixes an error were JavaScript on the dashboard was erroneously being enqueued</li>
<li>Ensures compatibility with the latest WordPress version</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.8</h3>
<ul>
<li>added a POT file</li>
<li>updated German translation, added formal version</li>
<li>updated plugin text domain to include a dash instead of an underscore</li>
<li>updated, translated + formatted README.md</li>
<li>updated expired link URLs in plugin and languages files</li>
<li>updated <a href="https://gist.github.com/glueckpress/f058c0ab973d45a72720" rel="nofollow">plugin authors</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.7</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removal of functions <em>Block comments from specific countries</em> and <em>Allow comments only in certain language</em> for financial reasons &#8211; <a href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/+SergejMüller/posts/ZyquhoYjUyF" rel="nofollow">more information</a> (only german)</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.6</h3>
<ul>
<li>Switch to the official Google Translation API &#8211; <a href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/+SergejMüller/posts/ZyquhoYjUyF" rel="nofollow">more information</a> (only german)</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 2.5 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.5</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Return parameters on <code>dashboard_glance_items</code> callback / thx <a href="https://twitter.com/toscho" rel="nofollow">@toscho</a></li>
<li>New function: Trust commenters with a Gravatar / thx <a href="https://twitter.com/glueckpress" rel="nofollow">@glueckpress</a></li>
<li>Additional plausibility checks and filters</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 12 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.4</h3>
<ul>
<li>Consideration of the comment time (Spam if a comment was written in less than 5 seconds) &#8211; <a href="https://plus.google.com/+SergejMüller/posts/73EbP6F1BgC" rel="nofollow">more information on Google+</a> (only german)</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 6.25 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Sorting for the Antispam Bee column in the spam comments overview</li>
<li>Code refactoring around the use of REQUEST_URI</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 2.75 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improving detection of fake IPs</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 11 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Code refactoring of options management</li>
<li>Support for <code>HTTP_FORWARDED_FOR</code> header</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 8.5 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Optimizations for WordPress 3.8</li>
<li>Clear invalid UTF-8 characters in comment fields</li>
<li>Spam reason as a column in the table with spam comments</li>
</ul>
<p>For the complete changelog, check out our <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">GitHub repository</a>.</p>

am-bee.2.9.0.zip";s:5:"2.9.1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.9.1.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:55:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:75:"https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=TD4AMD2D8EMZW";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:64:"https://ps.w.org/antispam-bee/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=977629";s:2:"2x";s:64:"https://ps.w.org/antispam-bee/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=977629";}s:18:"author_block_count";i:0;s:19:"author_block_rating";i:96;s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:15:"ultimate-member";a:31:{s:4:"name";s:60:"Ultimate Member &#8211; User Profile &amp; Membership Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:15:"ultimate-member";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.1.2";s:6:"author";s:56:"<a href="http://ultimatemember.com/">Ultimate Member</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/ultimatemember";s:8:"requires";s:3:"5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:86;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:660;i:4;i:47;i:3;i:20;i:2;i:31;i:1;i:101;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:859;s:15:"support_threads";i:465;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:440;s:10:"downloaded";i:3144005;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-12-04 9:26am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-01-21";s:8:"homepage";s:26:"http://ultimatemember.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:8408:"<h4>Best User Profile &amp; Membership Plugin for WordPress</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member is the #1 user profile &amp; membership plugin for WordPress. The plugin makes it a breeze for users to sign-up and become members of your website. The plugin allows you to add beautiful user profiles to your site and is perfect for creating advanced online communities and membership sites. Lightweight and highly extendible, Ultimate Member will enable you to create almost any type of site where users can join and become members with absolute ease.</p>
<h4>Features of the plugin include:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Front-end user profiles</li>
<li>Front-end user registration</li>
<li>Front-end user login</li>
<li>Custom form fields</li>
<li>Conditional logic for form fields</li>
<li>Drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>User account page</li>
<li>Custom user roles</li>
<li>Member directories</li>
<li>User emails</li>
<li>Content restriction</li>
<li>Conditional nav menus</li>
<li>Show author posts &amp; comments on user profiles</li>
<li>Developer friendly with dozens of actions and filters</li>
</ul>
<p>Read about all of the plugin&#8217;s features at <a href="https://ultimatemember.com" rel="nofollow">Ultimate Member</a></p>
<h4>Paid Extensions</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member has a range of extensions that allow you to extend the power of the plugin. You can purchase all of these extensions at a significant discount with our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/pricing/" rel="nofollow">All Access Pass</a> or you can purchase extensions individually.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/unsplash/" rel="nofollow">Unsplash</a> &#8211; Allow users to select a profile cover photo from <a href="https://unsplash.com/" rel="nofollow">Unsplash</a> from their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-bookmarks/" rel="nofollow">User Bookmarks</a> &#8211; Allow users to bookmark content from your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-photos/" rel="nofollow">User Photos</a> &#8211; Allow users to upload photos to their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/groups/" rel="nofollow">Groups</a> &#8211; Allow users to create and join groups around shared topics, interests etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-content/" rel="nofollow">Private Content</a> &#8211; Display private content to logged in users that only they can access</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/instagram/" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a> &#8211; Allow users to show their Instagram photos on their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-tags/" rel="nofollow">User Tags</a> &#8211; Lets you add a user tag system to your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-activity/" rel="nofollow">Social Activity</a> &#8211; Let users create public wall posts &amp; see the activity of other users</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/woocommerce/" rel="nofollow">WooCommerce</a> &#8211; Allow you to integrate WooCommerce with Ultimate Member</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-messages/" rel="nofollow">Private Messages</a> &#8211; Add a private messaging system to your site &amp; allow users to message each other</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/followers/" rel="nofollow">Followers</a> &#8211; Allow users to follow each other on your site and protect their profile information</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/real-time-notifications/" rel="nofollow">Real-time Notifications</a> &#8211; Add a notifications system to your site so users can receive real-time notifications</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-login/" rel="nofollow">Social Login</a> &#8211; Let users register &amp; login to your site via Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkedIn, Instagram and Vkontakte (VK.com)</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/bbpress/" rel="nofollow">bbPress</a> &#8211; With the bbPress extension you can beautifully integrate Ultimate Member with bbPress</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mailchimp/" rel="nofollow">MailChimp</a> &#8211; Allow users to subscribe to your MailChimp lists when they signup on your site and sync user meta to MailChimp</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-reviews/" rel="nofollow">User Reviews</a> &#8211; Allow users to rate &amp; review each other using a 5 star rate/review system</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/verified-users/" rel="nofollow">Verified Users</a> &#8211; Add a user verification system to your site so user accounts can be verified</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mycred/" rel="nofollow">myCRED</a> &#8211; With the myCRED extension you can integrate Ultimate Member with the popular myCRED points management plugin</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/notices/" rel="nofollow">Notices</a> &#8211; Alert users to important information using conditional notices</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/profile-completeness/" rel="nofollow">Profile Completeness</a> &#8211; Encourage or force users to complete their profiles with the profile completeness extension</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/friends/" rel="nofollow">Friends</a> &#8211; Allows users to become friends by sending &amp; accepting/rejecting friend requests</li>
</ul>
<h4>Free Extensions</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/forumwp/" rel="nofollow">ForumWP</a> &#8211; This free extension integrates Ultimate Member with the forum plugin <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com" rel="nofollow">ForumWP</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/terms-conditions/" rel="nofollow">Terms &amp; Conditions</a> &#8211; Add a terms and condition checkbox to your registration forms &amp; require users to agree to your T&amp;Cs before registering on your site.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/google-recaptcha/" rel="nofollow">Google reCAPTCHA</a> &#8211; Stop bots on your registration &amp; login forms with Google reCAPTCHA</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/online-users/" rel="nofollow">Online Users</a> &#8211; Display what users are online with this extension</li>
</ul>
<h4>Theme</h4>
<p>Our official <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow">theme</a> is purpose built for websites that have logged in and out users. The <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow">theme</a> has deep integration with Ultimate Member plugin and the extensions, different header designs for logged-in/out users and works alongside the Beaver Builder and Elementor page builders.</p>
<h4>ForumWP</h4>
<p>In addition to Ultimate Member we also have another plugin called <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com/" rel="nofollow">ForumWP</a>. ForumWP is a forum plugin which adds an online forum to your website, allowing users to create topics and write replies. Forums are a great way to build and grow an online community.</p>
<h4>Development * Translations</h4>
<p>If you&#8217;re a developer and would like to contribute to the source code of the plugin you can do so via our <a href="https://github.com/ultimatemember/ultimatemember" rel="nofollow">GitHub Repository</a>.</p>
<p>Want to add a new language to Ultimate Member? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/ultimate-member" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the list of UM Hooks, make this via our <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1324-hooks-list" rel="nofollow">Hooks Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the structure of our code, make this via our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/php-docs/" rel="nofollow">Documentation API</a>.</p>
<h4>Documentation &amp; Support</h4>
<p>Got a problem or need help with Ultimate Member? Head over to our <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow">documentation</a> and perform a search of the knowledge base. If you can’t find a solution to your issue then you can create a topic on the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/ultimate-member">support forum</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:264:"<ol>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>That&#8217;s it. Go to Ultimate Member &gt; Settings to customize plugin options</li>
<li>For more details, please visit the official <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a> page.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1288:"
<h4>Do I need to know any coding to use this plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, we have built Ultimate Member to be extremely easy to use and does not require you to manually build shortcodes or have any coding knowledge.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is Ultimate Member mobile responsive?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member is designed to adapt nicely to any screen resolution. It includes specific designs for phones, tablets and desktops.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is Ultimate Member multi-site compatible?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member works great on both single site and multi-site WordPress installs.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does the plugin work with any WordPress theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member will work with any properly coded theme. However, some themes may cause conflicts with the plugin. If you find a styling issue with your theme please create a post in the community forum.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does the plugin work with caching plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin works with popular caching plugins by automatically excluding Ultimate Member pages from being cached. This ensures other visitors to a page will not see the private information of another user. However, if you add features of Ultimate Member to other pages you have to exclude those pages from being cached through your cache plugin settings panel.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:102605:"<h4>Important:</h4>
<ul>
<li>To learn more about version 2.1 please see this <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/version-2-1-4/">topic</a></li>
<li>UM2.1+ is a significant update to the Member Directories&#8217; code base from 2.0.x. Please make sure you take a full-site backup with restore point before updating the plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.2: December 4, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added text-type filters</li>
<li>Added sorting for filters, tagline and reveal section fields</li>
<li>Added universal hook for field&#8217;s wrapper and improve rendering the field wrapper attributes</li>
<li>Added returning only existed values for select-type filters</li>
<li>Added checking privacy for custom fields in filters and general search, exclude private fields</li>
<li>Added Form fields validation for E-mail( not unique )</li>
<li>Added $user_id attribute in update profile hooks for proper callbacks</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed fields privacy, editable and visibility attributes</li>
<li>Fixed member directory styles</li>
<li>Fixed random sorting</li>
<li>Fixed conflict with &#8216;php_data&#8217; variable in admin JS</li>
<li>Fixed datepicker/timepicker filtering in the member directories</li>
<li>Fixed initialization of datepicker, timepicker, slider filters when the &#8220;Show results only after search/filtration&#8221; option is active</li>
<li>Fixed callback select-type filters handlers on member directories filters bar</li>
<li>Fixed cover photo thumbnail sizes in member directory</li>
<li>Fixed Role filter</li>
<li>Fixed clearing filters with || condition</li>
<li>Fixed endless recursion in the function um_check_conditions_on_submit()</li>
<li>Fixed issue that appears if we try to update several plugins at once</li>
<li>Fixed using different templates for different member directories</li>
<li>Fixed form previews, added overlay and displayed buttons</li>
<li>Fixed wp-admin/admin-post.php access issue</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.1: November 12, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:
<ul>
<li>Fixed admin actions hook</li>
<li>Fixed JS templates for list and grid view when user metakeys contain &#8220;-&#8221; symbol</li>
<li>Fixed JS template list &#8220;$show_block&#8221; issue</li>
<li>Fixed member directory search if &#8216;roles_can_search&#8217; is set</li>
<li>Fixed member directory filters bar animation</li>
<li>Fixed save profile with Last Login field</li>
<li>Fixed admin builder for profile form, show not editable fields</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.0: November 11, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added member directory list view</li>
<li>Added member directory search bar</li>
<li>Added member directory filters by range, date and time</li>
<li>Added AJAXed member directories</li>
<li>Updated member directories&#8217; search engine</li>
<li>Additional parameter &#8216;user_id&#8217; to action hook &#8216;um_user_after_updating_profile&#8217;</li>
<li>Added ability to set profile/cover image sizes from Ultimate Member -&gt; General -&gt; Uploads settings or Original size</li>
<li>Added ability edit cover photo HTML (e.g. for adding some HTML attributes. See how add srcset attribute based on all generated cover sizes <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1519-change-cover-photo-html" rel="nofollow">here</a>)</li>
<li>Added custom date format for Date Picker field</li>
<li>Added hook &#8216;um_show_meta_item_html&#8217; to customize user meta HTML at User Profile page</li>
<li>Added &#8220;aria-label&#8221; attribute in Field icon</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Optimized usermeta for Account submit security</li>
<li>Fixed flushing rewrite rules on every page reloading</li>
<li>Fixed Gmail &amp; Yahoo UTF-8 encoding of email notification subject</li>
<li>Fixed ajax_resize_image() process</li>
<li>Fixed country fields values</li>
<li>Fixed dynamic_profile.php notice</li>
<li>Fixed integration with WP native admin_post and admin_post_nopriv requests</li>
<li>Fixed profile image settings</li>
<li>Fixed profile privacy for not logged in users, if restriction options set for profile page as visible only for logged in and showing message instead of redirect<br />
(it makes the same for {site_url}/user and {site_url}/user/{user_slug} )</li>
<li>Fixed security issue on registration form submission when username or email have conditional logic</li>
<li>Fixed RTL styles issues on user profile and account pages</li>
<li>Fixed upload profile/cover photos at the profile page, don&#8217;t apply until the crop finished</li>
<li>Fixed alphabetical field validation for cyrillic and not UTF-8 symbols</li>
<li>Fixed user profile validation if username, username or email, password and email fields were added to form</li>
<li>Fixed user profile preview in admin Form Builder</li>
<li>Fixed getting templates function for some Windows servers</li>
<li>Fixed plugin update process for multisites</li>
<li>Fixed function &#8220;um_apply_conditions&#8221;. An error appears with jQuery v2.1.3</li>
<li>Localized um-raty.js library</li>
<li>Localized strings</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.56: August 21, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added security fixes (XSS)</li>
<li>Added hooks for 3rd party integrations</li>
<li>Updated Datepicker &amp; Timepicker library from 5.6 to 6.2 version</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed validation of forms conditional fields at the backend (for the nesting fields)</li>
<li>Fixed edit profile mode when profile menu is disabled</li>
<li>Fixed RTL styles and layouts</li>
<li>Fixed user profile description validation</li>
<li>Fixed JS errors on some installs</li>
<li>Fixed ability approve users by Administrator with special capabilities</li>
<li>Fixed multiselects&#8217; retrieval of options from callback function</li>
<li>Fixed save process and conditional logic for Appearances -&gt; Profile Menu settings section</li>
<li>Fixed uninstall process</li>
<li>Fixed is_selected method for some cases</li>
<li>Fixed form settings fields for default button labels in wp-admin metaboxes</li>
<li>Fixed generate metakeys for the form&#8217;s custom fields</li>
<li>Fixed issue when UM Roles localized as object on Add/Edit User screen</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.55: August 16, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:
<ul>
<li>Fixed profile privacy for not logged in users, if restriction options set for profile page as visible only for logged in</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.0.44: May 08, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added automatically template saver when you upgrade your theme</li>
<li>Added default value for Date and Time user profile fields</li>
<li>Updated Scroll library</li>
<li>Added REST API v2 class with new query vars. There is an ability to select v1 or v2 for use. For old users v1 is default, for new users v2</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added nocache headers to reset password form</li>
<li>Email templates saving to child theme, if parent theme already has email template files</li>
<li>Email templates locate in the default plugin folder with active WPML</li>
<li>Form builder with some predefined form fields, which had different keys/metakeys (currently use the same)</li>
<li>Logout redirect with active WPML</li>
<li>Fixed $_SERVER usage when WP-CLI using</li>
<li>Extended integration for UM field value</li>
<li>um_user function avoid loop when &#8216;display name&#8217; and &#8216;full name&#8217; used</li>
<li>Restriction options for Terms and access on front-end</li>
<li>Plugin/Theme upgrader</li>
<li>Remove duplicate data &#8216;user_login&#8217; from metadata</li>
<li>Replace placeholders duplicates</li>
<li>Password Reset link regeneration</li>
<li>Fixed issues with scroll on mobile devices</li>
<li>Fixed multisite activation</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Deprecated:</p>
<ul>

<h4>2.0.4: April 10, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added activation dependencies for extensions</li>
<li>Added Licenses checking and changed Licenses page</li>
<li>Added uninstall.php file for delete permanently all UM settings</li>
<li>Added ability to register users without WP Registration enabled</li>
<li>Added visual integration WPML+UM email notifications</li>
<li>Added Account Upgrade email notification</li>
<li>Added ability to register users using role field on Registration Form</li>
<li>Added Account page shortcodes for each tab content</li>
<li>Changed UM Option View (deprecated/added options)</li>
<li>Changed UM Roles, optimized for WP native logic</li>
<li>Changed backend forms/fields to WP native styles</li>
<li>Changed Content Restriction feature for posts, taxonomies, menus</li>
<li>Changed Email Notifications settings and using templates logic</li>
<li>Deprecated Redux Framework</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable options</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable forms metadata</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable member directories metadata</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable user roles metadata</li>
<li>Optimized registration/upgrade profile process (some hook deprecated)</li>
<li>Optimized some code parts, deprecated some functions</li>
<li>Updated <code>FontAwesome</code> library</li>
<li>Removed addons to separate extensions</li>
<li>Created Plugin Updater for getting updates and license details from Shop</li>
<li>Increased integration abilities, added new hooks (see new Hooks Docs + PHP documentation);</li>
<li>Integrated plugin activation, user creation processes with multisite</li>
<li>Make dependencies with extensions</li>
<li>OOP structure without procedural methods for wp-admin side;</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed avatars on some SSL installs</li>
<li>Fixed some vulnerabilities</li>
<li>Fixed integrations with core/extensions</li>
<li>Fixed <code>Edit Profile</code> button at members directory</li>
<li>Fixed conditional logic PHP validation and JS validation (for IE,Edge browsers)</li>
<li>Fixed textdomains for translations</li>
<li>Fixed integration with Woocommerce, SEO Framework, WPML</li>
<li>Fixed navigation menu items custom fields (<code>Mega Menu</code>, etc. compatibility)</li>
<li>Fixed theme conflicts with UM js libraries</li>
<li>Fixed and optimized handlers for user permalinks</li>
<li>Fixed replace placeholders for users</li>
<li>Fixed conditional fields logic</li>
<li>Fixed fields sanitize for remove XSS injections</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.3.73: November 17, 2016</h4>

<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a filter hook to modify the submitted details on registration process
<ul>
<li><code>um_before_save_filter_submitted</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds a filter hook to disable canonical link in header
<ul>
<li><code>um_allow_canonical__filter</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds a filter hook to modify the auto-generated email address on registration process
<ul>
<li><code>um_user_register_submitted__email</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds filter hooks to modify locale, language file path and textdomain
<ul>
<li><code>um_language_textdomain</code></li>
<li><code>um_language_locale</code></li>
<li><code>um_language_file</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds filter hook to modify the data of selected value:
<ul>
<li><code>um_is_selected_filter_data</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new select/multi-select options to retrieve options from a callback.
<ul>
<li>In the form builder, edit or add a select/multi-select field and add your callback function in <code>Choices callback</code> field to get populated.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds parent select field option to dynamically populate another select field.
<ul>
<li>If <code>Choices Callback</code> option is set in the field settings,  the <code>Parent Option</code> triggers an Ajax request to populate the child options on <code>change</code> event.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Updates <code>um.min.js</code> file.</li>
<li>Updates <code>en_US</code> translation file.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Removes notices from WPCLI console.</li>
<li>Removes notices from edit profile mode</li>
<li>Removes autocomplete from search filter fields</li>
<li>Fix translation strings of search filters on a member directory</li>
<li>Fix email notifications not sending on registration process</li>
<li>Fix field selection with special characters on form submission</li>
<li>Fix assigning of role on register submission process</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.3.72: October 10, 2016</h4>

</ul>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where multi-select field options doesn&#8217;t match the user selected options that contain html entities.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to display correct role slugs in radio and select fields.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where reset password form is conflicting with register and login form on a page.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where Users queue count in the Admin &gt; <code>All Users / Users</code> menu doesn&#8217;t update when a user account is in <code>pending user review</code> and gets deleted.</li>
<li>Fixes a typo in Password Reset Email option&#8217;s description</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where conditional fields &#8216;equals to&#8217; validation on registration process</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to disable the query with hiding account on member directory</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve specific number of members </li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve all members with <code>get_members</code> new parameter <code>number</code></li>
<li>Fixes a typo in Welcome Email template.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where login form redirection is set to <code>wp-admin/admin-ajax.php</code> instead of the current page when loaded via ajax.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where uninstall link doesn&#8217;t load.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to redirect users to correct URL after login based from login options.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where non-logged in users are not able to access the profile page when <code>Global Site Access</code> is set to <code>Site accessible to Logged In Users</code>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to modify the login redirection url especially when DOING_AJAX is defined.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve correct community roles per site in a Multisite Network setup.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.3.69: September 08, 2016</h4>

<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a system information tool for support purposes</li>
<li>Adds a new option to disable generating profile slugs on every load of member directory pages.
<ul>
<li>Located in UM &gt; Settings &gt; Advanced &gt; Stop generating profile slugs in member directory.</li>
<li>This improves the performance when loading profiles in directories. It generates profile slug on Profile Update ( front and back-end ), Registration Process and viewing the Users in the back-end.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new filter hook <code>um_activate_url</code> to modify the account activation url.</li>

<li>Tweak: exif module is not required anymore and does not stop photo uploads (exif is highly recommended)</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with changing a WP administrator role to a community administrator role</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with plugin uploads directory on some multisite installations</li>
<li>Fixed: conflict with default profile tab and editing profile</li>
<li>Fixed: minor css conflict on account page with some themes when viewed on tablets</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.34: January 31, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added option to set a default cover photo</li>
<li>New: added option to hide restricted content from search and archive</li>
<li>Fixed: php error in title tab with ElegantThemes</li>
<li>Fixed: theme conflict with photo/cover upload</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with country field showing country code in profile</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with setting default tab</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with 2-name user roles</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.33: January 30, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Introducing profile menu / tab system (optional)</li>
<li>New: display user posts and comments in profile menu (optional)</li>
<li>New: added option to force hide adminbar on the frontend even for administrators</li>
<li>Tweak: added profile menu options to plugin settings panel</li>
<li>Tweak: added option to enable/disable profile menu and/or profile menu tabs</li>
<li>Tweak: added option to show or hide post and comment counts (when the tabs are active)</li>
<li>Tweak: account activation via e-mail redirects user to login page and displays a success message</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with conditional logic on profile fields has been resolved</li>
<li>Fixed: bug with searching members by gender</li>
<li>Fixed: admin nav menus conditional logic conflict with some themes</li>
<li>Fixed: bug with datepicker field on windows servers</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.32: January 30, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added 3 new tags to use in email templates {first_name}, {last_name}, and {gender}</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with account page permalink resolved &#8211; <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/forums/topic/permalink-bug/" rel="nofollow">view issue</a></li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with conditional menu items showing for un-approved users resolved &#8211; <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/forums/topic/registration/" rel="nofollow">view issue</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.31: January 29, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with custom user page slug resolved <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/translate-plugin-9">view issue</a></li>
<li>Fixed: PHP warning in members directory resolved</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with hardcoded user profile URLs in menu</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.30: January 29, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added option to control number of profiles to display in members directory for mobile devices</li>
<li>New: new admin action hook &#8216;um_extend_admin_menu&#8217; to extend plugin administration menu</li>
<li>New: Improved plugin accessbility e.g add alt text to links and images so people with disabilities can use screen readers</li>
<li>New: added option to show/hide the message that appears if profile is empty (includes emoticon show/hide)</li>
<li>Tweak: new translatable strings</li>
<li>Tweak: added option to customize single-result text for members directory</li>
<li>Tweak: removed unnecessary code from member directory backend</li>
<li>Tweak: removed unnecessary js from admin head</li>
<li>Fixed: Account page is now translatable</li>
<li>Fixed: content restriction widget css in backend</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.29: January 28, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added feature to show user display name in menu (e.g. Welcome, {display_name})</li>
<li>New: added option to add text to dividers (which can be added using the drag-and-drop form builder)</li>
<li>New: security improvement: added whitelisted IP(s) option to allow you to access the WP-admin screen always (prevents lockout)</li>
<li>New: added filter hook um_whitelisted_wpadmin_access to control access to wp-admin login screens (for developers)</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to apply extra css styling rules from plugin settings</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to each form allowing you to apply extra styling rules per form</li>
<li>New: added option to customize profile fields area width (per form basis) besides global option</li>
<li>Tweak: compatibility with default permalinks (Pretty permalinks are strongly recommended though!)</li>
<li>Tweak: improved the function that gets user IP address</li>
<li>Tweak: performance: inline css from the plugin is automatically compressed/minified</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.28: January 27, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added compatibility with wpMandrill to handle email delivery</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with profile edit menu not appearing</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.27: January 27, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: WP admin bar issue with some plugins and themes</li>
<li>Fixed: conflict with WP Recent Comments With Avatars plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.26: January 26, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Important issue fix (update recommended)</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.25: January 26, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: addded support to use gravatars (optionally) If the user does not have a custom avatar</li>
<li>New: um_user_permissions_filter hook (for developer use)</li>
<li>Tweak: plugin uses get_avatar() properly now</li>
<li>Fixed: user avatars in backend are fixed</li>
<li>Fixed: Mobile_Detect class does not throw php error if it was previously called</li>
<li>Fixed: corrected a few translations errors</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.24: January 26, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: predefined fields are now localized (translatable)</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP warning in comments was fixed</li>
<li>Fixed: avatars in comments</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.23: January 25, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: important bugfix with profile editing</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.22: January 25, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: option to set maximum profile fields area width</li>
<li>New: ajax functions for future development use</li>
<li>Tweak: improved profile permalinks for e-mail based usernames</li>
<li>Tweak: disable user from editing username (If admin put the username field by mistake in profile)</li>
<li>Tweak: minor css changes</li>
<li>Fixed: ability to clear conditional logic from fields in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: corrected spacing issue in a multi-column layout in profile</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.21: January 24, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Added ajax action hook for development use</li>
<li>New: Extended profile hooks</li>
<li>New: you can restrict / apply access control to woocommerce shop page</li>
<li>Fixed: content restriction for woocommerce shop page</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.20: January 24, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Custom email is sent to user after resetting/changing password</li>
<li>New: Added action/filter hooks to profile</li>
<li>Tweak: Improved a few core functions</li>
<li>Fixed: Encoding issue with non-english sites fixed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.19: January 23, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Border thickness option for members directory</li>
<li>New: Option to show/hide forgot password link on login form</li>
<li>Tweak: Capital initials on members directory</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with row styling in form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Conditional logic bug fixes</li>
<li>Fixed: Icon for conditional rules in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: php warning in debug mode</li>
<li>Fixed: Mobile/phone number validation fixed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.18: January 23, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Form builder trash icon in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css adjustments in frontend</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: WordPress Multi-site compatibility for user uploads and photos</li>
<li>Fixed: Searching members by username or email in directory (partial search supported)</li>
<li>Fixed: Anonymous tracking</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Settings page: tracking popup removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: User profiles now show a cool message if the user profile field area is empty</li>
<li>New: Added &#8216;visibility&#8217; setting to all field types in backend</li>
<li>Tweak: Members search function supports partial search matching</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting photo or file removes file from server</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting a user will delete all his personal uploads from the server</li>
<li>Fixed: Duplicate tooltip for password field has been removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Template tags for welcome e-mail</li>
<li>Fixed: {submitted_registration} e-mail template tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0: January, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>First official release!</li>
</ul>
